abstract: During the final episode of “Lost,” Twitter exploded as devotees weighed in with commentary, nostalgia and playful jabs about the show.
snippet: During the final episode of “Lost,” Twitter exploded as devotees weighed in with commentary, nostalgia and playful jabs about the show.
lead_paragraph: By midafternoon Sunday, Twitter was ablaze with anticipation. The hot topic of conversation? The 4.5-hour conclusion  of “Lost,” which kicked off at 7 p.m. Eastern time with a recap of the show’s six seasons. As I reported on Saturday, “Lost” has amassed a huge following of devotees online, many of whom can’t resist the urge to trade one liners, dissect jaw-dropping plot twists and generally chitchat about the show on Twitter and Facebook as it airs.
